summary: Computer vision engineer with more than ten years of experience analyzing medical images using both classical image processing and deep learning.
Extensive track record of designing, developing, validating, and deploying machine learning models in regulated environments.
Technical leader with proven ability to turn cutting-edge research into robust, production-ready software.

experience.title: Chief Technical Officer
duties: Work with dermatologists to develop a suite of image analysis and deep learning solutions to assess skin health from cell phone photos.
Own the full machine learning stack: curate images, manage labeling, develop training pipelines, and validate clinical performance of five AI models.
Version and (automatically) deploy models behind documented APIs.

experience.title: Senior Scientist, MLOps Lead
duties: Led the technical development of an AI-driven brain cancer app from conception through FDA submission.
Built scalable machine learning devops using mlflow, quiltdata, and github actions.
Designed and developed a clean, well-documented, well-tested Python package for medical image analysis.

experience.title: Machine Learning & AI Engineer
duties: Designed and trained convolutional neural networks for segmentation of prostate MRIs.
Developed two academic prototypes into robust, production-level apps and helped guide them through FDA 510(k) clearance.
Wrote algorithms for registration and segmentation of head CTs for use by ER radiologists.

experience.title: Computer Vision Engineer
duties: Led a small Data Science R&D group responsible for building Uptake's capabilities in image analytics.
Developed object detection and change detection algorithms using both classical image analysis and deep learning for use with satellite imagery.
Designed, implemented, and trained convolutional neural networks; personally curated and labeled a 30,000-image dataset.

experience.title: Image Analysis & Data Visualization Consultant
duties: Scripted image processing – segmentation, registration, filtering, tracking – for microscopy and MRI research.
Installed software and provided tech support for users of RCC's 13,000 node cluster.
Taught "Image Analysis in Python" and "Introduction to RCC" workshops.

experience.title: MR Research Specialist / Assistant Researcher
duties: Pioneered novel methods for correction of patient motion during MRI acquisition.
Designed, implemented, and published real-time motion correction algorithms for use in clinical studies.
Received an intramural NIH grant to adapt MRI motion correction technology for use in a neonatal population.
Supported the lab by scripting data analysis, mentoring new hires, and organizing a journal club.

Computer Vision & Image Analysis: convolutional neural networks for image segmentation and object detection
Programming Languages & Frameworks: Python and scientific Python stack (numpy, scipy, scikit-learn, pandas)
Data Analysis & Machine Learning: standard techniques for supervised learning (linear models, random forests, neural networks) and unsupervised learning (PCA, k-means clustering)
versioning, labeling, and analysis of large image datasets
classical statistics for clinical data analysis

patents.name: Systems, devices, and methods for detecting false movements for motion correction during a medical imaging scan
